get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all active players.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full team information: team name and city, school, conference, and colors. Also contains full stadium data. This endpoint returns all teams regardless of current active status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info delivered live and post-game. Live data includes half and score info. Gameday info includes weather, TV channel etc

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: A full schedule of games for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all available players by team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: Returns the box score statistical record team-wide (aggregated from all players) for teams playing on a given date, both live and post-game.
get.summary: Team Game Stats - by Date [Live & Final]

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Returns all season-long stats (i.e. the season total, not each individual game record) for all teams (aggregated from all players) for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018POST, 2019.

get.description: Returns true if there is at least one game being played at the time of the request or false if there are none.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Player Details - by Player

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: playerid
parameters.description: Unique FantasyData Player ID. Example:60003802.

get.description: Year of the current season. This value changes at the start of the new league year. For leagues that run over two years, this is the year the season starts, not ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Returns the list of conferences, their teams, and standings.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Returns tournament info and games associated with the NCAA Tournament for the given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season.
Examples: 2018, 2019.

get.description: Returns all stadiums in CBB with school, capacity, latitude/longitude, city and state (and where applicable country.)

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: A list of all a team's games for a given season.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description: The abbreviation of the requested team. Examples: SF, NYY.

get.description: This endpoint provides all currently injured college basketball players, along with injury details.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Game by game log of total team statistics.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: Season to get games from. Example 2019POST, 2020

parameters.name: teamid
parameters.description: Unique ID of team. Example 1

parameters.name: numberofgames
parameters.description: How many games to return. Example all, 10, 25

get.description: The most basic top-line team information, such as team name, school and city, conference and division, stadium ID, and team colors. Returns all teams regardless of current active status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: A lightweight schedule endpoint without gameday information. Home and away teams, the date and time of the game, and season type etc. are included. Ideal for the most basic information required to build a schedule.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.

get.description: A slimmed-down score endpoint, giving just the quarter scores and final score, for simple applications.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Roster information for a given team. Player profiles include basic biographical information, position, etc. Specify a team code parameter to receive all players currently on that team.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: team
parameters.description:
The abbreviation of the requested team.
Examples: SMU, UCLA.

get.description: Full player bio and details, including injury notes, for all active players.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info, including half scores, delivered after the game ends.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description:
The date of the game(s).
Examples: 2018-FEB-27, 2017-DEC-01.

get.description: Full scores and gameday info, including half scores, for all games of a given season, delivered after each game ends

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Desired response format. Valid entries are XML or JSON.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description:
Year of the season (with optional season type).
Examples: 2018, 2018PRE, 2018POST, 2018STAR, 2019, etc.
